meanings.definition: A large area of flat unforested grassland in southeastern Europe or Siberia.
meanings.sent1: The steppe stretched out endlessly, covered in grass and under the open sky.
meanings.sent2: Many nomadic tribes roamed the steppe in search of new grazing grounds.
meanings.sent3: The steppe was so vast that even the horizon seemed to get lost in its expanse.
meanings.sent4: The steppe whispered secrets of ancient civilizations buried beneath its soil.
meanings.sent5: The steppe was a sea of green, waving gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To move in a specified direction by lifting one foot and putting it down in a different place.
meanings.sent1: She had to steppe carefully over the rocky terrain to avoid twisting her ankle.
meanings.sent2: The dancers steppe gracefully across the stage, mesmerizing the audience.
meanings.sent3: He tried to steppe lightly to sneak up on his friend, but stepped on a twig and gave himself away.
meanings.sent4: The soldiers steppe in perfect unison, their boots creating a rhythmic sound on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The cat steppe cautiously towards the mouse, ready to pounce at any moment.
